results.title: The Perils of Pauline
results.creator_credit: Sol Siegel, George Marshall and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Fabricated biography of silent serial queen, Pearl White. A frantic re-creation of old time Hollywood, with plenty of slapstick chases. Stars Betty Hutton, Billy De Wolfe, William Demarest, Constance Collier and Frank Faylen. Based on the story by P.J. Wolfson, with credit to Charles W. Goddard who wrote the original serial.

results.title: Aids: not adults only
results.creator_credit: Mandy Walker, Cristina Pozzan, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Four teenagers explore issues surrounding AIDS in frank and informative interviews with counsellors, other teenagers and a 19 year old who contracted the virus. Discusses how AIDS affects the current generation and challenges common misconceptions about the disease. The theme is prevention while simultaneously providing an opportunity for adolescents to review their attitudes and behaviour.

results.title: Heaven help us!
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Robert Kingsbury and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: There’s only one thing wrong with telephones: people use them. This film sets out to explain the simple rules of telephone etiquette with special effects and fantasy sequences. Max Meldrum plays an angel, who for some reason is in charge of heaven’s communications systems! Using a shonky business as an example, he explains the do’s and dont’s of good communication over the phone. Produced for the Australian Post Office.

results.title: Strikebound
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Richard Lowenstein, Timothy White, Miranda Bain and TRM Productions
results.brief_description: In the tiny Victorian town of Korumburra in the 1930’s two Scottish immigrants, Wattie and Agnes Doig, led the first ever stay-in strike in the nation’s history. It was a strike that gave hope and dignity to the life of the coal miner and brought new strengths and inspiration to the working men and women of Australia. This is a reconstruction of that historical event with the dramatisation placed between two excerpts from interviews with Wattie and Agnes Doig. Cast includes Chris Haywood, Carol Burns, Hugh Keays-Byrne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Bilcock, Richard Lowenstein, Timothy White, Miranda Bain and TRM Productions

results.title: T is for Tumbleweed
results.creator_credit: James A. Lebenthal, Louis Clyde Stoumen and Camera Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: Portrays without commentary the racing, creeping, leaping travels of a tumbleweed and the encounters it has with people, animals and things. Photographed by Haskell Wexler.

results.title: Action in Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, John Abbott and Department of the Army
results.brief_description: Scenes of the Australian Army First Battalion in South Vietnam. Shows part of a search and destroy mission in War Zone D. Also shows Vietnam under attack and the setting up of a medical post in a village. Narrated by Max Meldrum.

results.title: Collide
results.brief_description:
Collide is an interactive artwork comprising 9 images. It was born from a wish to make the viewing of the images a kind of journey- where the movement of the eye and the cursor make a path, mouse clicks causing progression along that path.

Using the metaphor of journey making the artist found a way to allow a progression from image to image by way of using a hotspot

results.title: What the Water Gave Me

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.description: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.
description_for_label: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.

results.title: Frida
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Ventanarosa Productions, Sarah Green, Salma Hayek, Joy Polstein, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Lindsay Flickinger, Roberto Sneider and Julie Taymor
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years, as we watch Frida’s journey to become a recognised artist in her own right.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Miramax Films, Ventanarosa Productions, Sarah Green, Salma Hayek, Joy Polstein, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Lindsay Flickinger, Roberto Sneider and Julie Taymor
results.description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.
description_for_label: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.
